column1: @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct to crush the coronavirus & safely reopen our economy. Instead of working to enact relief Republicans are abandoning bipartisan talks to focus on stealing a Supreme Court seat so they can overturn the ACA. https://t.co/xP4uxGKeeQ
I led the passage of the #HEROESAct in the House but the Senate still refuses to accept the public health emergency of COVID-19. The Senate must act now to save lives. https://t.co/bCRiTM2VrM

Tropical Storm Isaias hit NY while our communities were working to recover from the health and economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. People across the state lost power jeopardizing food security medical needs and access to essential services that NYers rely on.

#SocialSecurity is more vital than ever as many Americans face uncertain economic futures amidst COVID-19. The security this program provides for families also stimulates state and local economics as benefits are spent on food rent and other necessities. #Happy85SocialSecurity

Funding the @USPS is essential during the COVID-19 pandemic yet the Trump Admin continues its efforts to weaken the postal service. If President Trump is successful Americans will have to choose between their health & safety and their fundamental right to vote in November. https://t.co/MNOAfp6zA2

As we continue to face the COVID pandemic it is more important than ever that lower Hudson Valley residents have reliable electricity telephone and internet service. Customers deprived of these services should file claims and service providers must address their failures NOW.

NY has been on the front lines of the COVID-19 response. Full federal support for the National Guard relief effort is essential to prevent even greater burdens on taxpayers. I joined 116 of my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to demand the President act to aid our states. https://t.co/L1cbWupBpI

Adapting to COVID-19 will increase operating costs and HR 7327 will help our child care providers keep their doors open and lights on with a new refundable tax credit to help cover costs for rent mortgages and utilities. #SaveChildCare

We must address our nation’s pre-existing need for affordable quality child care & respond to the new challenge of COVID-19. HR 7237 invests $10 billion to fix hazardous conditions in child care facilities and to protect our children and caretakers from the virus. #SaveChildCare
I urge support for both H.R. 7327 and H.R. 7027 to provide critical relief for families child care providers and essential workers impacted by the coronavirus pandemic. #SaveChildCare

I am proud that the package also includes strong emergency appropriations to confront coronavirus and support economic recovery with investments in critical infrastructure and coronavirus preparedness response and relief domestically and globally.
I’m proud a local company – Pfizer – is in the race to develop a vaccine for COVID-19 through federal initiatives I’ve helped fund as Chair of the Appropriations Committee. https://t.co/IrXHuA9Htq

COVID-19 has made it more difficult to access affordable quality early childhood education. Thank you @Rosa_DeLauro for mentioning the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act which would address the needs of families teachers and students. https://t.co/ABHaJaKOft

In addition to helping parents safely return to work our bill would give more children healthy safe learning environments as we navigate reopening after the COVID outbreak. Child care supports our workforce today and nurtures the next generation of leaders. #SaveChildCare

The impact of COVID-19 on working families who count on #childcare has been devastating. This week I introduced the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act with my democratic colleagues. https://t.co/RP69gfXJi5

#COVID19 has devastated small businesses across our nation and Congress must continue to act aggressively to provide relief. While the PPP Flexibility Act is essential I urge @senatemajldr to take up the #HeroesAct which would further improve PPP for our communities.

While we exercise our right to protest we can’t forget the coronavirus disproportionately impacts minority communities. Get tested for #COVID19 if you are showing symptoms or think you have been exposed. Three newly-opened NYS-sponsored temporary testing sites in NY-1 7 here: https://t.co/JLjunCLvgD

As we collectively grieve after a weekend of pain that has shed light on our nation’s deep fissures may we take a moment to remember the over 100000 lives that have been lost in this country due to COVID-19. #DayOfMourning

I am devastated by the coronavirus death toll surpassing 100000 lives yesterday. With so many on this list from my district I am more motivated than ever to fight for the aid our communities so desperately need here in the Lower Hudson Valley.

As Chairwoman of @AppropsDems I helped secure billions in COVID-19 relief for #childcare in the CARES Act plus $7 billion more in the House-passed Heroes Act. Our bill today builds upon our ongoing efforts to help our communities in these uncertain times.

The Child Care is Essential Act prioritizes the health and safety of #childcare providers and the children they serve. Our bill ensures access to premium pay PPE mental health supports and more for modifications as a result of COVID-19.

#ChildCareIsEssential but #COVID19 has forced nearly half of #childcare providers to close. I’m proud to join my House and Senate colleagues in introducing the Child Care is Essential Act which establishes a $50 billion childcare stabilization fund. https://t.co/zywNpRqI15
On this unprecedented #MemorialDay may we also recognize the veterans whose time with us was cut short by the coronavirus. We are forever indebted to their bravery and courage.

For Head Start’s 55th Anniversary yesterday I’m looking back on my time spent with the children at #HeadStart of Rockland last year. I cannot thank Head Start enough for supporting our NY children and families over many generations and through many challenges including #COVID19 https://t.co/nOAb3o5llS

More than 86000 Americans & 27000 New Yorkers have died as a result of #covid19. The number of unemployed workers rivals that of the Great Depression. If this isn't enough for Republicans to join @HouseDemocrats in providing relief for American families I don’t know what is. https://t.co/URiflp7L3F

Today I introduced the #HeroesAct. In this bold comprehensive $3 trillion #COVID19 response is at least an estimated $100 billion in total relief for NY.  This includes $66 billion from a program I created to assist NY State county and local governments. https://t.co/rXMZop0Tcu

The coronavirus has become an undeniable danger to our democratic process. Unless we significantly increase election assistance states will not have the resources to adequately prepare during the pandemic. Read my op-ed with @RepMikeQuigley here⤵️ https://t.co/QhKS08xna6

During this unprecedented pandemic we need to ensure a better and fairer distribution of relief for small businesses and nonprofits impacted by #COVID19. Read my full letter to SBA Administrator Carranza here: https://t.co/0QErSaHme6
I thank all our teachers who won’t let #COVID19 stand in the way of our students’ success. #TeacherAppreciationWeek

31 members of the NYPD have died from COVID-19.   357 federal prison staff and 620 inmates nationwide have tested positive for coronavirus.   Congress must do more. Read my op-ed with @RepJoseSerrano:   https://t.co/pKF608XKMW

We observe #WorkersMemorialDay in very different circumstances remembering the workers across the country who have fallen victim to COVID-19.   We must protect our workers who courageously continue to work on the frontline in the fight against the virus.

Students are home because of #COVID19 but harassment of #LGBTQ youth persists. I’m proud to be an original cosponsor of the #DayofSilence Resolution. We must do our part to end the emotional & physical abuse students face because of sexual orientation or gender expression.
Do you have questions on the COVID-19 direct payments? Ask the IRS TOMORROW. Pre-registration is required. https://t.co/Ckea46z4o2

It is more important than ever that we pause to mourn past atrocities and mourn the passing of those who survived the holocaust who have lost their lives due to COVID-19. We must continue to tell their stories and honor their memory. #NeverAgain   https://t.co/Q1pNoYw24x

Those who can are spending more time indoors to stay healthy and stop the spread of #COVID19. Use this time to safely help your community get the resources it needs by completing the #2020Census online over the phone or by mail. Go to https://t.co/XScq4vu9ct. #ShapeYourFuture https://t.co/MySl1HbxeF

This coronavirus response package represents Congress’ ability to come together in a historic bipartisan way to ease some of the burden on our communities. This legislation will provide increased testing capacity PPE funding for health care providers & vaccine R&D. https://t.co/PyQqL5hADU

More than 6175 mental health professionals have volunteered their services free of charge to help New Yorkers cope with the stress caused by the coronavirus. I am overwhelmed with gratitude for the health care professionals who have volunteered.

Health centers across NYS & the courageous professionals that keep them running are key to the COVID-19 response. $5.2M in federal funding from the first coronavirus response package I led is supporting 63 New York health centers.

We are regularly updating our website with local closures CDC guidance and other important information related to the COVID-19 outbreak. Be sure to check in periodically for updates so you and your loved ones stay safe and informed.   https://t.co/3TrpXMZzxj

New York small businesses and qualified nonprofits severely impacted by the novel coronavirus now can apply for Economic Injury Disaster Loans referencing Disaster # NY-00197.   Applications are available now at https://t.co/sPoaJUa5J8

Westchester and Rockland county small businesses are facing extreme financial hardship as a result of COVID-19 which is why I called on the SBA to make a disaster declaration for New York immediately and secured a response in less than 48 hours.

Our district is home to one of the biggest coronavirus clusters in the state and country and the small businesses across the Lower Hudson Valley are the bedrock of our economy. We must support them in this time of crisis. Read my full letter here ⤵️ https://t.co/pUwzb6Tdsz

I commend the health professionals and local officials working hard to prevent the further spread of covid-19. We must all do our part to help stop its spread. I will continue working tirelessly to mitigate the impact of the coronavirus and bring an end to these uncertain times.
My prayers are with the family and friends of Rockland’s first victim of the coronavirus whose other health conditions are believed to have contributed to his death.

The Trump administration's emergency declaration does not do nearly enough to help families & communities.   To ensure the physical safety and financial security of Americans Congress must pass the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act.

COVID-19 TESTING: NYS opened its first drive-through mobile testing center in New Rochelle. Priority will be given to the vulnerable those with symptoms and individuals in New Rochelle living in the containment area. CALL AHEAD to make an appointment 888-364-3065
I’m hearing from constituents with questions about coronavirus testing and the European travel ban. Here are some helpful resources:
You can’t fight an enemy you can’t see. That’s why the #FamiliesFirst Act makes #coronavirus testing free. Congress must pass this legislation immediately.

Share these resources with those who have questions. These hotlines offer Spanish-speaking services.   People under self-quarantine or exposure to known case (866) 588-0195   NYS Department of Health COVID-19 (888) 364-3065   Westchester County COVID-19 Information Call 211

Helpful hotline phone numbers for those in NYS:  ➡️People under self-quarantine or exposure to known case call (866) 588-0195  ➡️NYS Department of Health COVID-19 Hotline (888) 364-3065  ➡️Westchester County COVID-19 Information Call 211

I called on the Trump Administration to quickly approve additional lab testing capabilities for the coronavirus. It is imperative that we have a multi-agency approach to ensure tests are readily available. https://t.co/VjHbfdSzSJ

I appreciated meeting earlier today with @CDCDirector Robert Redfield about the #coronavirus. Congress must provide robust funding to fully address this public health emergency and I am hopeful that we can come together to pass an emergency spending bill this week. https://t.co/hJlX1umG8h

In the face of public health crises the Trump Admin has consistently stalled neglecting to provide the necessary resources Americans need. It is especially alarming that the Administration is now proposing to take money from one emergency to pay for Coronavirus response. https://t.co/JfrI2d26yG
